back: A pdf created from data, for instance by dividing the range of the data into bins and assigning probability density to a bin that is proportional to the relative frequency of points in the bin and inversely proportional to the bin's width.

A technique for estimating the pdf of a data set under the assumption that the pdf is smooth. The estimated pdf can be constructed by taking a smooth shape, call a kernel, centering a copy of the kernel at each data point, adding all of the copies, and normalizing the result.
